questions.question_text:
A company would like to configure Financials, Workforce, and Projects. They would like to plan and forecast the Project dimension in Financials, as well as track employee utilization in Projects.
Which two actions must they take to ensure that the Project dimension is shared and the data integrated correctly across all three modules? (Choose two.)

choices.A: In Workforce, ensure that the granularity is at Employee or Employee and Job
choices.C: In Projects, ensure that the Employee driver-based expense is enabled
choices.D: In Workforce, rename one of the custom dimensions to "Project" and enable it
choices.B: In Financials, rename one of the custom dimensions to "Project" and enable it

discussion.content: AD is correct. https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/planning-budgeting-cloud/epbca/integration_scenarios_100xf03cdfeb.html. You do not need to add a Project dimension in Financials.
ABD, as you would need to have the project dimension re-mapped to custom in FS as well to have all three modules working together. As it was described, you should only have WF & PRJ connected.

comments.content:
B is incorrect:
If you are integrating Financials with Projects, note that aggregated data for total projects is pushed to Financials. You do not need to add a Project dimension in Financials. 
from
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/planning-budgeting-cloud/epbca/integration_scenarios_100xf03cdfeb.html

questions.question_text: In what three ways can Service Administrators implement EPM Automate in Planning? (Choose three.)

choices.B: To copy data from a block storage database to an aggregate storage database
choices.D: To import and export metadata, data, artifacts and snapshots
choices.E: To promote financial plans to the next level in the approval hierarchy
choices.A: To copy data from an aggregate storage database to a block storage database
choices.C: To execute scripts that complete tasks using a scheduler

questions.answer_description:
Copy data from one database to another; typically, from a block storage database to an aggregate storage database. You can create scripts that are capable of completing a wide array of tasks and automate their execution using a scheduler. Import and export metadata, data, artifact and application snapshots, templates, and Data Management mappings.
Reference:
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/enterprise-performance-management-common/cepma/using_epmctl.html
